DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Radiation therapy cause long-term adverse effect . Hyperbaric oxygen therapy may effective lessen gastrointestinal symptom cause radiation therapy give pelvic cancer . It yet know whether high-pressure oxygen effective treat adverse effect cause radiation therapy . PURPOSE : This randomized phase III trial study hyperbaric oxygen therapy see well work treat long-term gastrointestinal adverse effect cause radiation therapy patient pelvic cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy Treating Long-Term Gastrointestinal Adverse Effects Caused Radiation Therapy Patients With Pelvic Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To determine clinical benefit hyperbaric oxygen therapy reduce dysfunction patient pelvic cancer develop iatrogenic gastrointestinal symptom result previous radical pelvic radiotherapy complete least one year ago . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients stratify accord center severity symptom ( low vs high ) . Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . - Arm I ( treatment group ) : Patients undergo hyperbaric oxygen therapy 90 minute , 5 day week , 8 week total 40 treatment . Oxygen 100 % breathe 30 minute , follow 5-minute `` air break '' 30 minute breathe oxygen . A 5-minute `` air break '' follow 30 minute breathe oxygen . During final 10 minute oxygen breathe , chamber depressurize ambient atmospheric pressure linear rate ( 14.2 kPa/min ) . - Arm II ( control group ) : Patients undergo hyperbaric oxygen therapy 90 minute , 5 day week , 8 week total 40 treatment . Oxygen 21 % breathe 30 minute , follow 5-minute `` air break '' 30 minute breathe oxygen . A 5-minute `` air break '' follow 30 minute breathe oxygen . During final 10 minute oxygen breathe , chamber depressurize ambient atmospheric pressure linear rate ( 3 kPa/min ) . Tissue sample rectal biopsy may collect analyzed . Patients complete questionnaire ( Health Economics , Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire [ IBDQ ] , EORTC Quality Life [ QLQ ] -C30 , QLQ-CR38 ) baseline 3 , 6 , 9 , 12 month start treatment . After completion study treatment , patient follow within 14 day 10 month .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Past history rectal , prostate , testicular , bladder , uterine cervix , uterine corpus , vaginal , ovarian cancer Malignant disease ( T13 , N01 , M0 ) No evidence cancer recurrence Gastrointestinal symptom attributable prior radiotherapy receive least 1 year ago , meet 1 follow criterion : Grade 2 high Late Effects Normal Tissues Subjective , Objective , Management , Analytic Scales ( LENT SOMA ) category Grade 1 difficult intermittent symptom Symptoms relieve appropriate lifestyle advice medication 3month period PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Must physically psychologically fit undergo hyperbaric oxygen therapy No claustrophobia No epilepsy No chronic obstructive airway disease , bullous lung disease , acute chronic pulmonary infection , uncontrolled asthma , untreated pneumothorax No previous middle/inner ear operation ( except grommet similar procedure ) and/or inability equalize middle ear pressure No contraindication inability undergo magnetic resonance imaging , require rule malignancy PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics No prior surgery rectal cancer No prior hyperbaric oxygen therapy ( exclude treatment decompression illness ) No prior treatment bleomycin
